data.title: Sidebar misses 'current' viewlet indication
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (3a6eda74ead5b5b041da0bbc18b70218e8c95bba, 2017-05-31T05:06:36.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: Many

The currently open viewlet's icon on the sidebar used to have a brighter (in a dark theme) foreground color. That is missing from the current insiders. Maybe introduced with the theming work? /cc @bpasero

data.title: Typescript Intellisense hangs after Code has been open for awhile
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.1.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code with a project containing several hundred Typescript files.
2. Leave Code open for a long time (several days).
3. Hover over various symbols or press Shift-F12 to find all references.

I expect Intellisense/Code Lens to work normally. Instead, I get "Loading..." tooltips or windows that never resolve.

This is on the Windows platform

1.  Start Code
2.  Now try to start another instance (just like ctrl-shift-n does) by shift-clicking on the Code task icon.  Many apps will start another instance.

data.title: Support multiple terminals at once w/ Integrated Terminal
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Win 10 RS2 x64

Today you can set which terminal to use via the terminal.integrated.shell.windows key, but it only supports one terminal type at a time.  At this point I don't think it is odd that folks have multiple terminals they use in windows - CMD and Powershell have been coexisting for a long time, and its not uncommon to have a "configured" version of either with specific environment variables set (git terminal, vs terminal, etc.).  With WSL, Bash is thrown into the mix (and conceivably in RS3 we might want both a Fedora Bash and an Ubuntu Bash easily accessible, assuming both are installed).  

It would really be nice if terminal.integrated.shell.windows was an array rather than a simple key/value pair, so that we could launch whatever terminal we need at that point, rather than editing the settings file every time we want to launch a new terminal

data.title: git: Needlessly verbose list of  files on adding single folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 & Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Move a folder with a lot files into your up to date git local repository.

the source control side bar displays a very long list of files and with a '99+' on its icon.

meanwhile commandline git aggregates all that into a, much easier to read and less overwhelming, single line of output.
![vscodegitlonglist](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8478946/26688090/b409d2ee-46bf-11e7-8fbe-feeb33abaa2b.png)

data.title: "scripts\npm.bat install" fails to install v8-profiler using npm 5

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Trying to build and run vscode using the steps defined [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute)

It fails with the error:
```
npm

 ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! errno 1
npm ERR! v8-profiler@5.6.5 install: `node-gyp rebuild`
npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Failed at the v8-profiler@5.6.5 install script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     C:\Users\Admin\.npm-electron\_logs\2017-06-01T15_28_09_719Z-debug.log
```
Attached the log file
[2017-06-01T15_28_09_719Z-debug.log.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1045318/2017-06-01T15_28_09_719Z-debug.log.txt)

data.title: Feature Request: Terminal panel open to new window
data.body: When debugging or working with the terminal, I'd like to undock that panel to open it's own window since I work with multiple monitors. It'd free up a lot of space and wouldn't look so confined.

data.title: Debug Repl: output of same value no longer aggregated
data.body:
I am not sure when we lost support for this but we used to show a little number next to the output if the output was identical to the previous output, much like Chrome console works:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/26686760/3efb5390-46ee-11e7-8b68-1ec8a38e84cd.png)

I am no longer seeing this in the repl:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/26686777/4c318124-46ee-11e7-847e-cd3150f06961.png)

data.title: prevent Jasmine from autofilling from intellisense when mocha/chai is framework
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.13.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. using a project with mocha as the test running with chai, in a test begin typing expect(<<var>>).to
2. wait for intellisense to kick in and `toBe` etc will show up as jasmine suggestions
3. typing `.` will autofill, so will tabbing
4. in order to get `to.be`, `to.equal`, etc you have to hit space, backspace, then `.`

Ask: would like to be able to disable the Jasmine suggestions, or other languages

data.title: workbench.actions.view.problems should be workbench.action.view.problems (action not plural)
data.body:
It is the only workbench action in the "actions" namespace. Should be "action" not plural to match other commands.

Option 2: Use "workbench.view.problems" to match "workbench.view.extensons" though the "workbench.view" namespace is currently only for Side Bar views.

Option 3: "workbench.action.toggleProblems" which is more accurate.

data.title: --prof-startup stop too early
data.body: We have made some changes and now the profiler stop too early most likely not catching editor/viewlet restore.

data.title: Outdent / indent problem with whitespace significant languages
data.body:
Outdent / indent behavior of putting every like on indent line / "tab stop" is really annoying for the F# (and any other whitespace significant language). It would be good to provide option to override this behavior (preferably just additional setting).  The "right" behavior"  is just adding / removing X spaces, without making line content always begin on the indent line.

- VSCode Version: Latest Insider. Latest Stable
- OS Version: Windows (tho, it doesn't really matter)

Reproduction:
![indent_problems](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5427083/26683646/d3816f2c-46e4-11e7-9b6e-aafeda1b25fb.gif)

data.title: Reveal selected launch config when selecting configure
data.body:
* have a complex `launch.json`-file (like ours)
* have one entry select, like "Attach To Main process"
* select the configure gear icon
* the file opens but reveal my last edit location and I have to hunt for the current config. I'd say usability can be improved by revealing the source of "Attach to Main process"

data.title: Show extension recommendation in the gear-menu
data.body: Since we now show the little  at the lower left corner and since we now use it for update-notications I'd suggest to also use it for extension recommendation. Extension recommendations are useful but because they always jump into my face I discard them always without ever looking at them. I'd say the situation will be improved if we signal recommendation availability on the gear and have a command in its menu.

data.title: Feature Request: Add up arrow key to move to previous search term
data.body:
In sublime text, if I am focused in the search field and I click up, it moves to the previously searched term, just like in a terminal. I can keep going back how much I want, and it's usually scoped within the project.

Pressing down, as you might imagine, would rotate forward between the terms - just like in the terminal as well, until the last searched term.

This sounds like a simple feature in theory, but involves saving the search terms across sessions of vscode.

This may not sound that interesting, so I thought, so I held back and didn't submit the request, until I noticed I use this feature a couple of times a day, and would love to see it in vscode.

data.title: Use new UUIDMap from task configuration in extHostTask
Debugger on restart doesn't restart app
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Linux Ubuntu 16.04

Hello,

I recently started to use more VS Code launch settings and I discovered I can start and debug my app on the same time, but the problem is if I click restart it says `Killed` and launchs again node app, but the weird thing is it is not reachable...

launch.json
```json
{
	"version": "0.2.0",
	"configurations": [
		{
			"type": "node",
			"request": "launch",
			"name": "Launch Program",
			"program": "${workspaceRoot}/api/api.js",
			"console": "integratedTerminal"
		}
	]
}
```

Console on the first launch (F5):
```
svipben@ASUS-X555LN:~/Documents/emberjs-blog/api$ cd /home/svipben/Documents/emberjs-blog ; node --inspect=10852 --debug-brk api/api.js
Debugger listening on ws://127.0.0.1:10852/88af5dca-8851-4140-aa33-68e688107739
For help see https://nodejs.org/en/docs/inspector
Debugger attached.
(node:17250) [DEP0062] DeprecationWarning: `node --inspect --debug-brk` is deprecated. Please use `node --inspect-brk` instead.
info: Ember.js with API successfully launched at http://localhost:3000
```

Console after restart (Ctrl+Shift+F5):
```
Killed
svipben@ASUS-X555LN:~/Documents/emberjs-blog$ cd /home/svipben/Documents/emberjs-blog/api ; node --inspect=38557 --debug-brk api.js
Debugger listening on ws://127.0.0.1:38557/946b4cff-6323-4091-a3e9-9d9881106ded
For help see https://nodejs.org/en/docs/inspector
Debugger attached.
(node:17325) [DEP0062] DeprecationWarning: `node --inspect --debug-brk` is deprecated. Please use `node --inspect-brk` instead.
info: Ember.js with API successfully launched at http://localhost:3000
```

But after restart http://localhost:3000 it is not reachable, just nothing, process running but I can't reach the app...

data.title: Shortcut with enter in Integrated Terminal
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set up the following keybinding:
```json
    {
        "key": "shift+cmd+enter",
        "command": "workbench.action.toggleMaximizedPanel",
        "when": "terminalFocus"
    }
```
2. Open a Integrated Terminal
3. Use the new keybinding

What I got:
Inserted a enter/blank line in the Integrated Terminal

What I expected:
The panel to toggle between Maximized and non-maximized

data.title: Update proxy settings documentation
data.body:
In the current documentation, it says that for configuring a proxy server you must:

```
Configure the http.proxy setting in your user settings:
    "http.proxy": "https://10.203.0.1:5187/"
or for an authenticating proxy:
    "http.proxy": "https://userid:password@10.203.0.1:5187/"
Additionally, use "http.proxyStrictSSL": false if your proxy server uses a self-signed certificate.
```
Documentation located at: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/setup/setup-overview#_proxy-server-support

But, in recent builds (see #22214) that "http.proxy" setting is ignored. The only working way is to pass a parameter to code.exe:
--proxy-server=http://xxxxxx:8080
(see #22214 for details about auth, etc.)

I have spent two hours trying to figure this out, and the solution was really simple when known... please update documentation ASAP when such a big change is committed. Not all of us use "system wide proxy settings".

Anyway, thanks for such an awesome piece of software.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.2 (19222cdc84ce72202478ba1cec5cb557b71163de, 2017-05-10T13:20:36.315Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Configure "http.proxy" settings. They are ignored as expected (but not documented)
2.

data.title: Paste files across windows
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.2
- OS Version: Windows

Please add the feature that I can paste files in VS Code

My use case: I have two VS Code windows open:
1. I press Ctrl + C to copy one file from the explorer
2. I switch to the second window
3. I select a folder and the Paste option is greyed out (also can not press Ctrl + V)

This should be possible. Also copying & pasting files from the native explorer should be possible.

data.title: Pressing ESC should cancel drag operation
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. start to drag some text
2. press ESC

=> the drop operation executes
=> I would expect that the DND operation is canceled altogether when I press ESC key

data.title: Breakpoints/Callstack view: double click to move focus into editor
data.body: Typical behaviour in other viewers is to move focus to the editor upon double click. This action should also pin the editor if it is not pinned.
